claims.object: Mechanism enabling retention and accumulation of nanocarriers at tumor sites
Retention of nanocarriers at tumor sites
Accumulation of nanocarriers at tumor sites

surface_layer.definition: A phenomenon where nanocarriers preferentially accumulate in tumor tissue due to leaky vasculature and impaired lymphatic drainage.

deep_layer.mechanism: Tumor vasculature is often more permeable than normal vasculature, allowing nanoparticles to extravasate into the tumor microenvironment. The impaired lymphatic drainage in tumors prevents efficient clearance of these nanoparticles, leading to their accumulation.
deep_layer.origin: Observed during studies of drug delivery to tumors.
